data.question: Every weak entity set can be converted into a strong entity set by :
A weak entity set in an E-R diagram is an entity set that :
data.op2: must be part of a one to many relationship set
data.op3: is not existence dependent on a dominant entity
data.op4: must not participate as owner in an identifying relationship with another entity set

data.question: E-R model uses which symbol to represent weak entity set :
In an E-R, Y is the dominant entity and X is a subordinate entity. Then which of the following is incorrect ?
data.op1: operationally, If Y is deleted, so is X
data.op2: X existence is dependent on Y
data.op3: operationally, if X is deleted, so is Y
data.op4: operationally, if X is deleted, Y remains the same

data.question: The ER model includes additional concepts like :
Choose the most appropriate choice with respect to conceptual design.
data.op1: Conceptual design is a documentation technique. Once the relation schemes are defined one can draw E-R diagrams from the relation schemes for documentation
data.op2: Conceptual design needs data volumn and processing frequencies to determine the size of the database
data.op3: Output of any conceptual design is an E-R diagram
data.op4: Conceptual design involves modeling the data requirements independent of the BMS, operating system and the hardware.

data.question: In an E-R model Oval represents :
The number of entities to which another entity can be associated via a relationship set is expressed as :
Every weak entity set can be converted to a strong entity set by :
data.op4: Repeating the entity set several times

data.question: Relations produced from an E-R model will always be in :
An association of several entities in an Entity-Relation model is called :
The attributes made up of more than one single attributes are called :
Which of the following keys uniquely identifies the entity set ?
In ER model the details of the entities are hidden from the user. This process is called :
